results.definition: an appraisal of the state of affairs
examples: a check on its dependability under stress

results.definition: be verified or confirmed; pass inspection
examples: These stories don't check!

results.definition: make cracks or chinks in
examples: The heat checked the paint

results.definition: a mark left after a small piece has been chopped or broken off of something
examine so as to determine accuracy, quality, or condition
examples: check the brakes

results.definition: develop (a child's or animal's) behavior by instruction and practice; especially to teach self-control
become fractured; break or crack on the surface only
lessen the intensity of; temper; hold in restraint; hold or keep within limits
the state of inactivity following an interruption
examples: held them in check

results.definition: find out, learn, or determine with certainty, usually by making an inquiry or other effort
slow the growth or development of
a written order directing a bank to pay money
examples: he paid all his bills by check

results.definition: be careful or certain to do something; make certain of something
mark into squares or draw squares on; draw crossed lines on
additional proof that something that was believed (some fact or hypothesis or theory) is correct
a mark indicating that something has been noted or completed etc.
examples: as he called the role he put a check mark by each student's name

results.definition: the act of inspecting or verifying
examples: they made a check of their equipment
the pilot ran through the check-out procedure

results.definition: something immaterial that interferes with or delays action or progress
the bill in a restaurant
examples: he asked the waiter for the check

results.definition: put a check mark on or near or next to
examples: Please check each name on the list

results.definition: be compatible, similar or consistent; coincide in their characteristics
examples: The handwriting checks with the signature on the check

results.definition: hold back, as of a danger or an enemy; check the expansion or influence of
the act of restraining power or action or limiting excess
abandon the intended prey, turn, and pursue an inferior prey
arrest the motion (of something) abruptly
examples: He checked the flow of water by shutting off the main valve

results.definition: a textile pattern of squares or crossed lines (resembling a checkerboard)
examples: she wore a skirt with checks

results.definition: block or impede (a player from the opposing team) in ice hockey
(chess) a direct attack on an opponent's king
consign for shipment on a vehicle
examples: check your luggage before boarding

results.definition: decline to initiate betting
hand over something to somebody as for temporary safekeeping
make an examination or investigation
examples: check into the rumor
check the time of the class

results.definition: obstructing an opponent in ice hockey
place into check
examples: He checked my kings

results.definition: stop for a moment, as if out of uncertainty or caution
examples: She checked for an instant and missed a step

results.definition: stop in a chase especially when scent is lost
examples: The dog checked

results.definition: verify by consulting a source or authority
examples: check the spelling of this word
check your facts

results.definition: write out a check on a bank account
